Okay let us see. Blitzcrank builds no ap items and does not focus on ap runes.

We have 6 levels. 1 rank on the ultimate, 1 on w, then 2 on q and 2 on e. 

Q deals - 190 ap damage.
W deals - no damage
E deals - 61.5 + 3.5 x 5= 77 x 2 = 154 ad damage.
R deals - 250 ap damage.
Greenfathers gift - 27 magical damage

In total that is 467 ap damage plus 154 ad damage. That is, if it was pure damage. So let us count resitances. 

Let us take the runes of defence that caitlyn will have from this most popular and upvoted guide in mobafire - http://www.mobafire.com/league-of-legends/build/boom-headshot-preseason-guide-gameplay-video-full-game-443013.

Caitlyn defences.

Level 6 hp - 524.4 + 80 x 5 = 924.4 hp

Level 6 magic resistance + magic resist glyphs - 30 + 1.34 x 9 =  42.06

Level 6 armor + seals of armor - 22.88 + 3.5 x 5 + 9 x 1 = 49.38

Now let us count

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

FIGHT!

For armor reduction calculation i used this chart - http://i.imgur.com/VbwUZkt.png

33% of 154 = 50.82 reduction, meaning that the ability will deal 154 - 50.58 = 103.42 ad damage.

Luckily the formulas used to count armor effectiveness are the same as counting the effectiveness of MR, so we can use the same chart for the ap.

30% of 467 = 140 reduction, meaning that the abilities will deal 467 - 140 = 327 ap damage.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Conclusion.

In the end Caitlyn will lose 103.42 + 327 = 430.42 hp out of 924.4.

Meaning that by the end she will have 493.98 hp.

I think you two are talking about different things.

Brand is classified as a mage, but he can still be played in the support role. Heck, Brand even has the 12th highest win rate out of the 28 supports. 

For me, since Brand only has a skillshot stun in his kit, I like to play him with ADCs that also have crowd control like slows or stuns. {{champion:202}} {{champion:222}} {{champion:22}} are the first three that comes to mind. He also works well into squishy supports, and struggles against initiators. Long story short, like every champion, he thrives in certain match-ups and struggles in others.

As for the lack of crowd control, I find that {{item:3116}} and {{item:3030}} are good at protecting that weakness. Rylai's is a given, and since my damage spreads to other targets so do my slow. I would buy RoA if I was going mid, but GLP-800 gives me similar stats and a way to land my skills easier on close targets. Of course, {{item:2301}} and cooldown boots are also essential for Brand support.

To wrap it up, let me summarize; Brand has a place in the bot lane just as much as he has a place mid lane. Just because a champion doesn't technically 'support' the ADC doesn't mean that it's bad. Let Brand's win rate of 50.75% tell you such. Brand works in certain games splendidly, and shouldn't be counted out of the support role.

He is still not a support, i will never accept a support that can nearly kill my adc in just one spell rotation. That is not a support, that is a mage.

Any other mid lane mage on bot does not have such a high damage output and a nearly instant kill on an adc in one rotation.

I do not refer to brand as "not support" because that he lacks cc. I refuse to refer to him as a support because he is a goddamn carry even in a "support" role due to his huge damage output even without items, which is a problem, it is one of the reasons why vel'koz support was once really popular and too good.

Brand is simply too strong as a support and he is simply a mage.

Brand is not a support, his damage output even without any items is too high, he is a bot mage, not a support in any circumstance.

Did you even read my comment? Literally my second sentence said that Brand is a MAGE. Both MAGES and SUPPORTS can be played in the support ROLE. Brand is not a SUPPORT, but he is a MAGE, so therefore he can be played in the support role.

Even the new improved player guide (No, not the tutorial that says you should build Thornmail on Ashe. The NEW player guide that actually is better for new players on the website) states that a mage's common positions include mid lane AND support.

Plus, if you find that you can't beat Brand as Bard (which, if Brand plays around your stuns, would be normal since Brand counters Bard), then play someone like Leona or Alistar, who can jump on Brand and lock him down. Or play away from Brand; his skill shots (Q and W) can be easily avoided if you are aware.
